creator: dennisl@apache.org
text:
Platform: Solaris 8, Sparc
Webserver: Apache 1.3.22
Servlet container: Tomcat 4.0.2
mod_jk was built using the build-solaris.sh script.

When using mod_jk/1.1.0 (from jakarta-tomcat-3.3a) things work just fine. But
when we use mod_jk/1.2.0 (from jakarta-tomcat-connectors-4.0.2-src) we get the
entires in Apaches error_log that look like this, when we try to access a
servlet or jsp:

[Thu Feb 14 10:58:30 2002] [notice] child pid 13024 exit signal Segmentation
Fault (11)

When we change JkLogLevel to "debug" from "info" things start to work. All
loglevels beside "debug" causes segmentation faults.

Can you send a stack trace ( gdb httpd core, then bt ) ?

This is most likely due to a printf(%s) with null argument, jk2 has replaced
all calls to APR equivalent. 
I'll do a search on the source and check the log statements.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
hgomez@slib.fr
text:
Ok, we should take a look at all jk_log since I didn't have
this behaviour on mod_jk 1.2.0 on my Linux Boxes.

BTW, it's strange that you get such error message when 
loglevel != debug, since in debug level mode you get 
much more messages

creator: funkman@joedog.org
text:
This bug is now pretty old and I think this might be fixed. Please use latest
connectors and reopen if this is still not working.
